words.example: ___ is where the fictional SGC is located.

words.name: Appropriate
words.example: One should use ___ force when engaging the enemy.

words.name: Obnoxious
words.example: That dude is such an ___ jackass.

words.name: Nocturnality
words.hint: When an animal's primary activities take place during nighttime.
words.example: The owl is known for its ___

words.name: Manageable
words.hint: adj. not too difficult or big to attempt.
words.example: You should divide up your project into ___ chunks.

words.name: Dichotomy
words.hint: noun. Two things represented as something the opposite or different from each other.
words.example: You're setting up a false ___ where none exists.

words.name: Enthusiasm
words.hint: noun. Enjoyment and interest in a given subject.
words.example: My ___ for the game runs low.

words.name: Peculiar
words.example: A ___ man came in town driving a clown car.

words.name: Explanation
words.hint: noun. The reason the way or how something is
words.example: The ___ for how car engines work is unclear.

words.name: Catastrophic
words.example: Even a tiny flaw in a rocket can result in a ___ event known as Rapid Unplanned Diassembly.

words.name: Laboratory
words.hint: n. a facility designed for scientific and techological research.
words.example: In Dexter's __, a child prodigy hid a ___ from his parents.

words.name: Nitinol
words.hint: n. an alloy of titanium and nickel.
words.example: Four applications for the alloy ___ includes 'Superelasticity', 'work production', 'constrained recovery', and 'free recovery'.

words.name: Hygiene
words.hint: n. health condition and set of practices for maintaining one's health.
words.example: American high school started too early, reducing the overall sleep ___ of the population, and thus resulting in lower performance.

words.name: Suppressive fire
words.hint: n. The concept of temporarily rendering an enemy ineffective with the use of weaponry so that they can be eliminated more easily.
words.example: In ground warfare, most of weapon fire is geared toward ___ rather than outright taking out the target.

words.name: Substantially
words.hint: adverb. In great amount, important, as opposed to minor or only slightly.
words.example: In the last ten years, nobody had advanced spaceflight as much as SpaceX.

words.name: Preliminary
words.hint: adjective. An initial action that prepare for something larger.
words.example: A ___ investigation has been conducted, but revealed nothing yet. More investigation and time is needed.

words.name: Obsolescence
words.hint: n. The eventual condition of becoming unwanted, useless, or unnecessary.
words.example: Some people alleged that manufacturers conspire in a process called planned ___ to keep us buying new goods.

words.name: Logarithm
words.hint: n. The power needed to raise a number exponentionally to produce a third number.

words.name: Intricacy
words.example: If you dive deep enough into a subject, you will find that the ___ of the subject keeps getting deeper.
